title: Quickest Change Detection with Cost-Constrained Experiment Design
summary: This paper addresses the quickest change detection problem where an observer monitors a stochastic process and, at each observation time, chooses between multiple experiments with varying information qualities and costs. The objective is to minimize the worst-case average detection delay under false alarm and cost constraints.
usefulness_reason: Score 60 assigned because the paper discusses monitoring a "stochastic process" and "at each observation time, the decision-maker needs to choose between multiple experiments". This aligns with the concept of a "Point Process" where events occur at specific times. While not explicitly spatio-temporal, the temporal aspect of a point process is present.
